Review Text: Very friendly waitress, Tami was wonderful!!! Energetic and fun. Will def go back ! Happy hour prices are very nice. Great view of Las Olas and fun to people watch. Locals special, most tourists aren't familiar with this location. Close to everything!

Situated in apt locations n from Victoria crown plaza. Its typical indian restaurant in Lagos but service was kinda slow . Food was good , spicy enough . Suitable for business meets as well as personal meetings

Visited with our friends.. Good ambiance and tasty Indian food.. The best out of all I have visited in Lagos..worth spending..  Located in a silent traffic free location with parking.Grilled veg/nonveg options were available...must visit place in Lagos..

Review Title: Excellent Hotel. The only Hotel for Indian Food.
Review Text: We had stayed in Indigo Hotel for 6 days in the month of January 2015. The hotel is excellent, with very friendly staff, the rooms are huge and very neat and clean. The best part is the Vegetarian Indian food which we got was awesome.  I would recommend every one going to Lagos to stay in Indigo Hotel.

The furnishings are simple, and the place is very clean and neat -  much better then some of the other Guest houses I've stayed at in Lagos. There are 5 TV channels available, 2 of them are indian, there is a news and a sports channel.  I thoroughly enjoyed the hospitality at this place - the manager called me every evening to find out what I would like as part of the complimentary Breakfast offering as well as what I would like for Dinner.   The Food is absolutely amazing indian cuisine especially considering that you are in the heart of North West Africa!.  My Only gripe is that the Room window looks out onto the Generator and the Street which are both extremely noise and it's dificult if not impossible to get a decent nights rest - Carry Ear plugs if you want to sleep at
Room Tips: All the rooms would generally be noisy, Room 5 has 2 Queen size beds, I was given this room even...
